sentence.Network_en: Toddlers are notoriously antisocial when it comes to sharing toys.
sentence.Network_cn: 众所周知，刚学会走路的孩子不愿和别人分享玩具。

sentence.Network_en: His first essay in running a company was a notoriously tough undertaking.
sentence.Network_cn: 众所周知，他第一次尝试经营公司时十分艰难。

sentence.Network_en: Diplomats can be a notoriously unreliable and misleading source of information.
sentence.Network_cn: 外交官可能会提供一些靠不住的误导性信息，这是众所周知的。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 新概念第三册 ... Lesson 52 Mud is mud 实事求是 notoriously adv. （尤指因坏事）众所周知地 full-time adj. 专职的.
ReadyWin English ... shoreline n. 海岸线 notoriously adv. 臭名昭著地 unexpected adj. 出乎意料的，意料之外的.
王玉梅托福词汇 Word_list_26_在线英语听力室 ... note 音符 notoriously 声名狼藉地 nourish 养育；滋养.
近似字词-新浪字典 ... notoriety 恶名,丑名,声名狼藉 notoriously [坏的方面] 有名地 notoriousness [坏的] 有名气.

list.abs: Granted , Japan ' s GDP figures are notoriously erratic , and this jump follows a poor third quarter ., 诚然 , 日本的 GDP 数字著名的反复无常的 , 这个暴涨缘于可怜的第三季度.
... [publicity;reputation] 名声;名誉 [shady;be notorious;infamous;with a bad reputation] 形容名声极坏 [sonar] 声能.

in one notorious example a series of 1990s television shows self-explanatory title , Breaking the Magicians Code , won big audiences by revealing the secrets behind classic illusions .举一个有名的例子。上世纪90年代，一部片名不言而喻的电视系列节目——《破译魔术师的密码》（BreakingtheMagiciansCode)—
英语短语搭配 - 豆丁网 ... noted for （以……著名） notorious for （因……臭名昭著） possible for （有可能）.

entry.tran: 声名狼藉的;臭名昭著的;众所周知的
entry.def: To be notorious means to be well-known for something bad.

example.ex: ...an area notorious for drugs, crime and violence...
example.tran: 因毒品、犯罪和暴力而臭名昭著的地区

example.ex: She told us the story of one of Britain's most notorious country house murders.
example.tran: 她给我们讲述了英国最有名的一起乡村别墅谋杀案。

sentences.sentence: "European emigres, who notoriously used to repair to the British Museum to write seditious pamphlets"

auth_sentence.content: The IPO game is notoriously dicey for retail investors.
auth_sentence.res_content: The IPO game is notoriously dicey for retail investors.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The IPO game is notoriously dicey for retail investors.

auth_sentence.content: Risk assessment is a notoriously difficult concept to communicate.
auth_sentence.res_content: Risk assessment is a notoriously difficult concept to communicate.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Risk assessment is a notoriously difficult concept to communicate.

auth_sentence.content: It has a notoriously paltry system of public transportation.
auth_sentence.res_content: It has a notoriously paltry system of public transportation.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It has a notoriously paltry system of public transportation.

Sentence.sentence: Political sentiment is notoriously changeable: What if things begin to go wrong for Obama, and his popularity slumps?

means.word_mean: 恶名昭彰地,声名狼藉地

sentences.en: one of the most notoriously corrupt city councils
sentences.cn: 贪污腐败最为臭名昭著的市参议会之一

sentences.en: Birth rates are notoriously difficult to predict.
sentences.cn: 众所周知，出生率是很难预测的。

sentences.en: Civil court proceedings are notoriously slow.
sentences.cn: 民事诉讼程序的耗时长是无人不知的。

sentences.en: Maps of the region are notoriously inaccurate.
sentences.cn: 众所周知，这一地区的地图都不太精确。
